Posts.Content: Hi, My name is Jacky.  I too have metaplastic br cancer and have just had recurrence in the chest wall after having mastectomy, chemo and radiation two years ago.  I too am trying desperately to find anyone who can successfully treat this rare type of cancer, so if you hear any news would you please let me know, by printing it on this message board.  I understand yourfrustrations and only hope that someone out there can give us some useful info.   Jacky
Posts.Title: Metastic Metaplastic Heterologous Carcinoma of The Breast

Posts.Content: Hi, My name is Jacky.  I live in the UK. I was diagnosed with metaplastic breast cancer in Oct 2005.  I had six lots of FEC chemotherapy and 3 weeks of radiotherapy.  So far I have been fine. I would love to hear  any info you manage to find about this type of cancer, as I have very little knowledge like you about what our chances are.
Posts.Title: Metaplastic Breast Carcinoma

Posts.Content: Hi, Its Jacky S again. Just to update, I recently had a recurrence in the scar tissue from my mastectomy. So obviously the FEC and radiation did not work for me.  However it has been removed successfully and am now hoping for no more recurrences.  Still haven't been able to find anything which could be of any help.  Jacky S.
Posts.Title: Metaplastic Breast Carcinoma

Posts.Content: Hi, I would be very interested in talking to others or joining a website for mataplastic breast survivors.  I am 46 years old and was diagnosed in 2005. Had mastectomy,chemo (6xFEC) and radiotherapy.  Sentinel node biopsy was clear. my oncologist said I was stage 2, grade 3.  I had a hard time with chemo, but radiotherapy was much easier.  Am now fit and well.  Just trying to get on with things and stop worrying about re-occurrence.  It would be so much easier if there was more information about metaplastic cancer. My tumour was also non hormone receptive. Is this normal with this type of cancer? JS
Posts.Title: Mepaplastic breast cancer

Posts.Content: Hi , I am so sorry to hear your cancer has metastisized.  I too have metaplastic breast cancer and like you am desperate to find a cure, or anything that has even helped to slow it down.  If you are given any good advice please post it on the board so we all can see, and good luck!!
Posts.Title: Metaplastic Breast Cancer has metasticized

Posts.Content: Hi, My name is Jacky. I live in the UK and was diagnosed with triple neg br cancer in October 2005.  I had three ops ending with mastectomy,  6 treatemnts of FEC then 3 weks radiation. Have had 1st year mammogram and 3 monthly checks. So far so good. Will have 2nd year mamo in a few weeks. Fingers crossed. Hope things are going well for you too.
Posts.Title: triple negative br. cancer
